original:
The model proposed by Gérard Debreu represents a specific instance within the broader framework of generalized abstract economies. In Debreu's model, preference correspondences are defined using utility functions, expressed mathematically as:

\[ P_i(x) := \{ z_i \in X_i : U_i(z_i, x_{-i}) > U_i(x_i, x_{-i}) \} \]

In this formulation, \( P_i(x) \) denotes the set of alternatives \( z_i \) that an agent \( i \) prefers over their curren
